meanings.definition: To make (something) known to the public.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to publicise their new product through social media.
meanings.sent2: Businesses often publicise their services through television commercials.
meanings.sent3: I will publicise my cat's birthday party to all the neighborhood pets.
meanings.sent4: The bright neon sign publicised the entrance to the magical world of the amusement park.
meanings.sent5: She used a megaphone to publicise the emergency evacuation instructions.

meanings.definition: To promote or advertise (something) to the general public.
meanings.sent1: The local bakery will publicise their special holiday treats in the newspaper.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often publicise their campaign promises during speeches.
meanings.sent3: I will publicise my love for pizza by wearing a pizza costume to the party.
meanings.sent4: The artist's vibrant paintings publicised the beauty of nature in a unique way.
meanings.sent5: The catchy jingle was used to publicise the new ice cream flavors at the shop.
